result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven R Singer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid at $35.00 per month commencing 9/15/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 9 days jail for non-payment.  Costs may be paid by performing Community Service at a rate of $10.00 per hour.
**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
With Huber.  LAST 30 DAYS STAYED for Day Report Center.  Sentence credit of 7 days was granted.  Release for work and treatment.

To comply with Day Report Center for 60 days, consecutive to Huber sentence.  Good time NOT allowed on Day Report Center.  If defendant successfully completes Day Report Center, the 30 days of Huber stayed will be permanently stayed.
  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. 

Consecutive to: Huber sentence.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

Report from Day Report Center

Defendant Steven R Singer in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Denise Rawski from Day Report Center appears.  Case called for review hearing.  Ms. Rawski makes statements.  Defendant's time has expired for Day Report Center.  Court takes no action.

(Fax) DRC Non-Compliance Report dated 09/23/16.   Sent to Judge Carter for review.
09/26/16, approved by the Court.

(Fax) DRC Non-Compliance Report dated 09/20/16.   Sent to Judge Carter for review.
09/20/16, Court orders a review hearing.

WCS Day Report Center Non-Compliance Report.   Sent to Judge Carter for review.  
Signed by Judge Carter on 08/26/16.

Defendant Steven R Singer in court with Attorney Jorge R Fragoso, as friend of the court today.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Denise R. from Day Report Center appears. Case called for review hearing - review of Day Report Center.  Denise R. from Day Report Center makes statements regarding positive test results.  Attorney Fragoso makes statements regarding positive results.  State makes statements.  Court grants DRC's recommendation for sanction (writing an essay) and orders Defendant to follow DRC's rules.
(Fax) Dated 08/19/16, from WCS Day Report Center, giving update of program participation.
WCS Day Report Center Non-Compliance Report received today.     Signed by Judge Carter on 08/16/16. Court ordered a review hearing on 08/22 at 830 am.
Judgment of Conviction returned.
letter from Hebron House dated 2/25/16 filed by Attorney Fragoso
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Steven R Singer in court with Attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentence.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Fragoso makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:

HUBER:  30 days, LAST 30 DAYS STAYED for Day Report Center (7 days credit).  Release for work, treatment.  Defendant to report to Huber facility by 12:00 p.m. on July 29, 2016. 

DAY REPORT CENTER:  60  DAYS, Consecutive to Huber sentence.  Good time not allowed on DRC.  If defendant successfully completes Day Report Center, the 30 days of Huber stayed will be permanently stayed. 

____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid at $35.00 per month, commencing 9/15/16, alternate 9 days jail if not paid - may be paid by performin community service at rate of $10.00 per hour)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department**
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 07/28/16.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Filed by Atty Fragoso.

Atty Fragoso states that the Defendant had a conflict due to medical reasons and requests another plea/sentencing hearing. Court sets.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.
